content: A rare disease is a condition that affects fewer than 200,000 people at any given time.
Genetic diseases affect the DNA, or genetic instructions, which directs how tissues, organs, and body systems function
Inherited metabolic diseases, or inborn errors of metabolism, are a group of genetic diseases that affect the ability of the body's cells to convert food into energy.
Mitochondrial diseases are a group of genetic diseases that affect the ability of the body's cells to make energy.
Neurological diseases affect the brain, spinal cord, cranial nerves, autonomic nerves, or other peripheral nerves.
Birth defects (also known as congenital abnormalities) are structural changes present at birth that can affect almost any part of the body, including how the body looks, works, or both.
